line_1: His truth was fair without a flaw;
line_2: His word was holden as a law.

line_1: That N—— cannot find, nor make a Flaw,
line_2: Suppose thy Writings so well fenc'd in Law,

line_1: Yet still reserves an undermining Flaw.
line_2: The Knave, who fences your Estate by Law,

line_1: His looks hae made a flaw;
Life for obedience, death for ev'ry flaw.
line_2: From Sinai's top Jehovah gave the law,

line_1: In such resolves, doth passion make a flaw,
line_2: And bring to nothing, what was rais'd to law.

line_1: And here a failing found, and there a flaw;
line_2: The wise, the good, with anxious heart he saw,

line_1: Those narrow windows with the frequent flaw?
line_2: Reigns here alone: else why that roof of straw?

line_1: Or some frail China Jar receive a Flaw,
line_2: Whether the Nymph shall break Diana's Law,

line_1: Succeeded; when to varnish o'er each flaw,
line_2: And bow the world with superstitious awe,

line_1: No! the decree was just and without flaw,
line_2: And he that made, had right to make the law;

line_1: When the pack'd jury, and the quibbled flaw
line_2: Delude the eye, and lame the arm of law;
